intro: Boissiera baetica, commonly known as the Baetican boissiera, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Boissiera baetica thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
